f12d0218-c50d-4101-811e-77cfaad66554.text: Men exist for the sake of one another. Teach them then or bear with them.
f12d0218-c50d-4101-811e-77cfaad66554.author: Marcus Aurelius

90e772eb-418b-4f71-988d-4a4112cf87a8.text: Moreover, to endure labour; nor to need many things; when I have anything to do, to do it myself rather than by others; not to meddle with many businesses; and not easily to admit of any slander.
90e772eb-418b-4f71-988d-4a4112cf87a8.author: Marcus Aurelius

58fdbec1-bd47-4351-9d94-068b1214248e.text: My city and my country, as I am Antoninus, is Rome; as I am a man, it is the world.
58fdbec1-bd47-4351-9d94-068b1214248e.author: Marcus Aurelius

bf9e840d-879c-41e9-9baf-4d5d47ef7efc.text: My mind. What is it? What am I making of it? What am I using it for? Is it empty of thought? Isolated and torn loose from those around it? Melted into flesh and blended with it, so that it shares its urges?
bf9e840d-879c-41e9-9baf-4d5d47ef7efc.author: Marcus Aurelius

40982966-4639-43e5-ad28-b7ee4b7d78b5.text: Neither must he use himself to cut off actions only, but thoughts and imaginations also, that are unnecessary for so will unnecessary consequent actions the better be prevented and cut off.
40982966-4639-43e5-ad28-b7ee4b7d78b5.author: Marcus Aurelius

51cc6186-3821-4bc0-bcce-b948a30987f9.text: Neither worse then nor better is a thing made by being praised.
51cc6186-3821-4bc0-bcce-b948a30987f9.author: Marcus Aurelius

ed757cc8-1055-4331-9811-08c688f5c7b3.text: Neither worse then or better is a thing made by being praised.
ed757cc8-1055-4331-9811-08c688f5c7b3.author: Marcus Aurelius

12e0959c-3bd1-43a1-9747-deb7c5b43724.text: Never ceases to amaze me: we all love ourselves more than other people, but care more about their opinion than our own.
12e0959c-3bd1-43a1-9747-deb7c5b43724.author: Marcus Aurelius

1d9cda54-d115-497c-9347-8901c1907bfe.text: Never esteem anything as of advantage to you that will make you break your word or lose your self-respect.
1d9cda54-d115-497c-9347-8901c1907bfe.author: Marcus Aurelius

1d62c2c2-855f-4df2-9cfe-7fc613d851ec.text: Never esteem of anything as profitable, which shall ever constrain thee either to break thy faith, or to lose thy modesty; to hate any man, to suspect, to curse, to dissemble, to lust after anything, that requireth the secret of walls or veils.
1d62c2c2-855f-4df2-9cfe-7fc613d851ec.author: Marcus Aurelius

099373bf-eacd-46c4-9848-8c4e8e7e53de.text: Never let the future disturb you - you will meet it with the same weapons of reason and mind that, today, guard you against the present...
099373bf-eacd-46c4-9848-8c4e8e7e53de.author: Marcus Aurelius

13b94da9-8789-454c-a5da-6bd21aecc214.text: Never let the future disturb you. You will meet it, if you have to, with the same weapons of reason which today arm you against the present.
13b94da9-8789-454c-a5da-6bd21aecc214.author: Marcus Aurelius

6dbf5ec5-1ff5-4e3f-9093-e955fb21169b.text: Never shirk the proper dispatch of your duty, no matter if you are freezing or hot, groggy or well-rested, vilified or praised, not even if dying or pressed by other demands.
6dbf5ec5-1ff5-4e3f-9093-e955fb21169b.author: Marcus Aurelius

57e36fe7-6d7e-4af8-b233-e259310f8993.text: Never value anything as profitable that compels you to break your promise, to lose your self-respect, to hate any man, to suspect, to curse, to act the hypocrite, to desire anything that needs walls and curtains.
57e36fe7-6d7e-4af8-b233-e259310f8993.author: Marcus Aurelius

e8e4034e-ec88-43e1-aa58-96d36d4fc271.text: Never value the advantages derived from anything involving breach of faith, loss of self-respect, hatred, suspicion, or execration of others, insincerity, or the desire for something which has to be veiled and curtained.
e8e4034e-ec88-43e1-aa58-96d36d4fc271.author: Marcus Aurelius

689698ae-0e9f-49a2-a1a2-953af3edb332.text: Never wilt your soul, never be just good, simple or unpolished. Manifest more then the body that surrounds yourself.
689698ae-0e9f-49a2-a1a2-953af3edb332.author: Marcus Aurelius

8cb93b5d-2e69-4f3a-82b4-065aa1363a0a.text: No difference between here and there: the city that you live in is the world.
8cb93b5d-2e69-4f3a-82b4-065aa1363a0a.author: Marcus Aurelius

c1862df2-4c8e-4b4a-b62a-d02a8330ee71.text: No man is happy who does not think himself so.
c1862df2-4c8e-4b4a-b62a-d02a8330ee71.author: Marcus Aurelius

4802f5c9-4ebd-45f9-9a38-ec55ac2340d0.text: No matter what anyone says or does, my task is to be good. like gold or emerald or purple repeating to itself, "no matter what anyone says or does, my task is to be emerald, my color undiminished."
4802f5c9-4ebd-45f9-9a38-ec55ac2340d0.author: Marcus Aurelius

2844023d-e84b-4714-aca0-1234c9426879.text: No more roundabout discussions of what makes a good man. Be one!
2844023d-e84b-4714-aca0-1234c9426879.author: Marcus Aurelius

0d9645a5-a203-4486-8ba5-7fabc173bf83.text: No one can lose either the past or the future - how could anyone be deprived of what he does not possess? ... It is only the present moment of which either stands to be deprived: and if this is all he has, he cannot lose what he does not have.
0d9645a5-a203-4486-8ba5-7fabc173bf83.author: Marcus Aurelius

69160deb-ede0-45a5-b826-1190b4b72e81.text: No one loses any other life than the one he now lives, nor does one live any other life than that which he will lose.
69160deb-ede0-45a5-b826-1190b4b72e81.author: Marcus Aurelius

ff098164-6cfd-48d6-8ee5-353cb65832f4.text: No random actions, none not based on underlying principles.
ff098164-6cfd-48d6-8ee5-353cb65832f4.author: Marcus Aurelius

dd92bb6a-50ea-4760-b550-37a692fae86c.text: None of us have much time. And yet you act as if things were eternal—the way you fear and long for them.… Before long, darkness. And whoever buries you mourned in their turn.
dd92bb6a-50ea-4760-b550-37a692fae86c.author: Marcus Aurelius

f3f33f96-b0d6-407c-b25b-5c914a738780.text: Nor does he deviate from the way which leads to the end of life, to which a man ought to come pure, tranquil, ready to depart, and without any compulsion perfectly reconciled to his lot.
f3f33f96-b0d6-407c-b25b-5c914a738780.author: Marcus Aurelius

1e960f22-930a-46f4-8548-303cb36f9e54.text: Not to assume it’s impossible because you find it hard. But to recognize that if it’s humanly possible, you can do it too.
1e960f22-930a-46f4-8548-303cb36f9e54.author: Marcus Aurelius

42833ea6-b027-401b-9cab-fb5044067d6f.text: Not to be offended with other men's liberty of speech, and to apply myself unto philosophy.
42833ea6-b027-401b-9cab-fb5044067d6f.author: Marcus Aurelius

c730939f-fb24-4dd1-86da-f4e911f2fc7b.text: Not to be offended with other men's liberty of speech.
c730939f-fb24-4dd1-86da-f4e911f2fc7b.author: Marcus Aurelius

7fc06249-32ac-40e8-8512-4f5975379e74.text: Not to be overwhelmed by what you imagine, but just do what you can and should.
7fc06249-32ac-40e8-8512-4f5975379e74.author: Marcus Aurelius

0c3eec42-520b-437b-bec3-65952c7a497a.text: Not to know what the world is is to be ignorant of where you are. Not to know why it’s here is to be ignorant of who you are. And what it is. Not to know any of this is to be ignorant of why you’re here.
0c3eec42-520b-437b-bec3-65952c7a497a.author: Marcus Aurelius

e7007afe-50b7-4935-8c17-69bb630ad953.text: Not to live as if you had endless years ahead of you. Death overshadows you. While you’re alive and able—be good.
e7007afe-50b7-4935-8c17-69bb630ad953.author: Marcus Aurelius

bd1fccdf-1562-456c-8dec-4a94db9637b1.text: Not to waste time on nonsense. Not to be taken in by conjurors and hoodoo artists with their talk about incantations and exorcism and all the rest of it. Not to be obsessed with quail-fighting or other crazes like that.
bd1fccdf-1562-456c-8dec-4a94db9637b1.author: Marcus Aurelius

8f2eb2f6-3b39-4521-836a-5d47394d21b6.text: Nothing happens to any man that he is not formed by nature to bear.
8f2eb2f6-3b39-4521-836a-5d47394d21b6.author: Marcus Aurelius

1e31820c-8a9a-4cb6-a3c5-55ffcbc972b1.text: Nothing happens to any man which he is not formed by nature to bear.
1e31820c-8a9a-4cb6-a3c5-55ffcbc972b1.author: Marcus Aurelius

915aa357-0540-4d7c-9b16-43701ec8739e.text: Nothing happens to anybody which he is not fitted by nature to bear.
915aa357-0540-4d7c-9b16-43701ec8739e.author: Marcus Aurelius

82d1bd6f-12be-4d6c-8521-b99b58962424.text: Nothing has such power to broaden the mind as the ability to investigate systematically and truly all that comes under thy observation in life.
82d1bd6f-12be-4d6c-8521-b99b58962424.author: Marcus Aurelius

e9485a44-f75c-4778-990c-cb1de3df3fc8.text: Nothing is as encouraging as when virtues are visibly embodied in the people around us, when we’re practically showered with them.
e9485a44-f75c-4778-990c-cb1de3df3fc8.author: Marcus Aurelius

6f48e03f-0de8-4787-a23a-517b880156e5.text: Nothing is more scandalous than a man that is proud of his humility.
6f48e03f-0de8-4787-a23a-517b880156e5.author: Marcus Aurelius

f7214933-d56a-490d-842a-f1d308476933.text: Nothing that goes on in anyone else’s mind can harm you.
f7214933-d56a-490d-842a-f1d308476933.author: Marcus Aurelius

889d2506-61d0-4025-a8fd-4b560b1b1885.text: Nothing that goes on in anyone else’s mind can harm you. Nor can the shifts and changes in the world around you. —Then where is harm to be found? In your capacity to see it.
889d2506-61d0-4025-a8fd-4b560b1b1885.author: Marcus Aurelius

f5ea5642-9fe1-4a67-accd-f27138ab12c3.text: Now a man should take away not only unnecessary acts, but also, unnecessary thoughts, for thus superfluous acts will not follow after.
f5ea5642-9fe1-4a67-accd-f27138ab12c3.author: Marcus Aurelius

a87ce119-b05a-4d36-bfd2-dcc49c4852e0.text: Nowhere can man find a quieter or more untroubled retreat than in his own soul.
a87ce119-b05a-4d36-bfd2-dcc49c4852e0.author: Marcus Aurelius

a1d647b9-f55c-4a7a-a875-9ba108dcf1b5.text: Nowhere you can go is more peaceful—more free of interruptions—than your own soul.
a1d647b9-f55c-4a7a-a875-9ba108dcf1b5.author: Marcus Aurelius

a68d336a-3892-4cfb-a9cd-5edbb48ad2e4.text: Objective judgment … Unselfish action … Willing acceptance … of all external events.
a68d336a-3892-4cfb-a9cd-5edbb48ad2e4.author: Marcus Aurelius

877a1305-d22c-498b-a570-981d9857e94c.text: Objective judgment, now, at this very moment. Unselfish action, now, at this very moment. Willing acceptance—now, at this very moment—of all external events. That’s all you need.
877a1305-d22c-498b-a570-981d9857e94c.author: Marcus Aurelius

ca98fdf3-391c-4680-92da-38efbc339645.text: Observe always that everything is the result of change, and get used to thinking that there is nothing Nature loves so well as to change existing forms and make new ones like them.
ca98fdf3-391c-4680-92da-38efbc339645.author: Marcus Aurelius

19986306-a9f8-4fc2-8be8-59cf1333b864.text: Observe the movements of the stars as if you were running their courses with them, and let your mind constantly dwell on the changes of the elements into each other. Such imaginings wash away the filth of life on the ground.
19986306-a9f8-4fc2-8be8-59cf1333b864.author: Marcus Aurelius

26ac44b1-cd19-4f0a-8f6e-3ab0391f15e6.text: Occupy thyself with few things, says the philosopher, if thou wouldst be tranquil.
26ac44b1-cd19-4f0a-8f6e-3ab0391f15e6.author: Marcus Aurelius

9622df9d-832f-45ca-a5f8-4ce6fb21a528.text: Of all existing things some are in our power, and others are not in our power.
9622df9d-832f-45ca-a5f8-4ce6fb21a528.author: Marcus Aurelius

61e4c313-4e9c-41da-a9cb-8a7d8290b180.text: Of my grandfather Verus I have learned to be gentle and meek, and to refrain from all anger and passion.
61e4c313-4e9c-41da-a9cb-8a7d8290b180.author: Marcus Aurelius

0273deb3-3b0b-4bf2-997a-550fe0fd1882.text: On every occasion a man should ask himself, Is this one of the unnecessary things?
0273deb3-3b0b-4bf2-997a-550fe0fd1882.author: Marcus Aurelius

b30eb0bd-4bc2-49ca-a7b7-245a472bd122.text: Our actions may be impeded by them, but there can be no impeding our intentions or our dispositions. Because we can accommodate and adapt. The mind adapts and converts to its own purposes the obstacle to our acting.
b30eb0bd-4bc2-49ca-a7b7-245a472bd122.author: Marcus Aurelius

f7c9f539-c115-4bfa-a756-c31be074f6d8.text: Our life is a warfare, and a mere pilgrimage.
f7c9f539-c115-4bfa-a756-c31be074f6d8.author: Marcus Aurelius

51edda6b-9c57-4ea3-af2f-2e530e01e16c.text: Our life is what our thoughts make it.
51edda6b-9c57-4ea3-af2f-2e530e01e16c.author: Marcus Aurelius

19e0761a-10bf-4f8d-ab02-b4bbbea9e90f.text: Our own worth is measured by what we devote our energy to.
19e0761a-10bf-4f8d-ab02-b4bbbea9e90f.author: Marcus Aurelius

da379a9e-989b-4138-88c5-51d35a2bdee5.text: Our own worth is measured by what we devote our energy to.  4.
da379a9e-989b-4138-88c5-51d35a2bdee5.author: Marcus Aurelius

1bc4cf6c-c433-4ac7-a863-4e009e5bb8f3.text: Our thoughts is what our life make it.
1bc4cf6c-c433-4ac7-a863-4e009e5bb8f3.author: Marcus Aurelius

a90ec551-57ef-42f5-8d65-c3dda2abde0a.text: Pass then through this little space of time conformably to nature, and end thy journey in content, just as an olive falls off when it is ripe, blessing nature who produced it, and thanking the tree on which it grew.
a90ec551-57ef-42f5-8d65-c3dda2abde0a.author: Marcus Aurelius

c38b4134-9667-4e20-8f19-0f0e766bd04b.text: People out for posthumous fame forget that the Generations To Come will be the same annoying people they know now.
c38b4134-9667-4e20-8f19-0f0e766bd04b.author: Marcus Aurelius

fdfd75aa-d3e7-4449-96cb-c1195e84b04e.text: People who are excited by posthumous fame forget that the people who remember them will soon die too. And those after them in turn. Until their memory, passed from one to another like a candle flame, gutters and goes out.
fdfd75aa-d3e7-4449-96cb-c1195e84b04e.author: Marcus Aurelius

283dd1d7-1c21-40ab-9e75-d2ab06cb4631.text: People who labor all their lives but have no purpose to direct every thought and impulse toward are wasting their time—even when hard at work.
283dd1d7-1c21-40ab-9e75-d2ab06cb4631.author: Marcus Aurelius

3e06cd07-4d10-4e45-85fc-2df3513db351.text: Perfection of character is this: to live each day as if it were your last, without frenzy, without apathy, without pretence.
3e06cd07-4d10-4e45-85fc-2df3513db351.author: Marcus Aurelius

559dd856-9da4-48b3-8c13-68ff4c30f884.text: Perfection of character: to live your last day, every day, without frenzy, or sloth, or pretense.
559dd856-9da4-48b3-8c13-68ff4c30f884.author: Marcus Aurelius

72e39d45-5ec3-41aa-aee3-42c23b11abd1.text: Practice even what seems impossible. The left hand is useless at almost everything, for lack of practice. But it guides the reins better than the right. From practice.
72e39d45-5ec3-41aa-aee3-42c23b11abd1.author: Marcus Aurelius

9e82d01c-56f4-4a26-96de-ac26ec786e99.text: Pride is a master of deception: when you think you're occupied in the weightiest business, that's when he has you in his spell.
9e82d01c-56f4-4a26-96de-ac26ec786e99.author: Marcus Aurelius

c50429ca-8fa8-432e-a0b3-02331370c1a6.text: Pride is a master of deception: when you think you’re occupied in the weightiest business, that’s when he has you in his spell.
c50429ca-8fa8-432e-a0b3-02331370c1a6.author: Marcus Aurelius

4e2429e3-37fb-4649-b575-0973d99a1284.text: Put from you the belief that 'I have been wronged', and with it will go the feeling. Reject your sense of injury, and the injury itself disappears.
4e2429e3-37fb-4649-b575-0973d99a1284.author: Marcus Aurelius

d2c852b6-d822-4a8e-a457-d4e795e659b5.text: Put from you the belief that I have been wronged and with it will go the feeling. Reject your sense of injury, and the injury itself disappears.
d2c852b6-d822-4a8e-a457-d4e795e659b5.author: Marcus Aurelius

6c566611-d08a-4b2e-a558-75e2c6ac3b98.text: Receive without conceit, release without struggle.
6c566611-d08a-4b2e-a558-75e2c6ac3b98.author: Marcus Aurelius

397d657c-8276-42a4-b3b5-27f901e27d94.text: Recognize the malice, cunning, and hypocrisy that power produces, and the peculiar ruthlessness often shown by people from “good families.”
397d657c-8276-42a4-b3b5-27f901e27d94.author: Marcus Aurelius

76f9767b-f72f-4376-b246-f9dee04c9190.text: Refrain from all anger and passion.
76f9767b-f72f-4376-b246-f9dee04c9190.author: Marcus Aurelius

2c4d651e-87dd-482c-90d7-e25e382614a1.text: Regain your senses, call yourself back, and once again wake up. Now that you realize that only dreams were troubling you, view this 'reality' as you view your dreams.
2c4d651e-87dd-482c-90d7-e25e382614a1.author: Marcus Aurelius

469b187f-242e-48ff-aa69-0cc4a30bb514.text: Reject your sense of injury and the injury itself disappears.
469b187f-242e-48ff-aa69-0cc4a30bb514.author: Marcus Aurelius

bbb3b915-169c-4920-826e-e9e60cc4d273.text: Reject your sense of injury, and the injury itself disappears.
bbb3b915-169c-4920-826e-e9e60cc4d273.author: Marcus Aurelius

5e278820-6911-43bd-be30-234076d6b163.text: Remember how long thou hast already put off these things, and how often a certain day and hour as it were, having been set unto thee by the gods, thou hast neglected it.
5e278820-6911-43bd-be30-234076d6b163.author: Marcus Aurelius

b8bdeaa4-8867-4860-b2c8-2f09226cafbf.text: Remember how long thou hast already put off these things, and how.
b8bdeaa4-8867-4860-b2c8-2f09226cafbf.author: Marcus Aurelius

5182ab60-af86-4b1d-a604-33cd24150fd6.text: Remember how long you have been putting off these things, and how often you have received an opportunity from the gods, and yet do not use it.
5182ab60-af86-4b1d-a604-33cd24150fd6.author: Marcus Aurelius

3ca974e2-905a-4432-ade9-33592b2fa7d2.text: Remember that our efforts are subject to circumstances; you weren’t aiming to do the impossible. —Aiming to do what, then? To try. And you succeeded. What you set out to do is accomplished.
3ca974e2-905a-4432-ade9-33592b2fa7d2.author: Marcus Aurelius

94b0fceb-e6a4-4827-bc5f-e0ec9e588e23.text: Remember that very little is needed to make a happy life.
94b0fceb-e6a4-4827-bc5f-e0ec9e588e23.author: Marcus Aurelius

64c43861-fe26-4712-a679-f7d59ba6f534.text: Remember this, that very little is needed to make a happy life.
64c43861-fe26-4712-a679-f7d59ba6f534.author: Marcus Aurelius

9ba63498-53fd-4e45-8ccc-88d8d4e4f5ad.text: Remember, however, that thou art formed by nature to bear everything, with respect to which it depends on thy own opinion to make it endurable and tolerable, by thinking that it is either thy interest or thy duty to do this.
9ba63498-53fd-4e45-8ccc-88d8d4e4f5ad.author: Marcus Aurelius

3f449d4d-c9b1-4f26-adfb-1d956b6f6b5d.text: Remember, however, that you are formed by nature to bear everything whose tolerability depends on your own opinion to make it so, by thinking that it is in your interest or duty to do so.
3f449d4d-c9b1-4f26-adfb-1d956b6f6b5d.author: Marcus Aurelius

de83c885-33b1-4f12-8a0a-d58cdb732631.text: Remember, nothing belongs to you but your flesh and blood—and nothing else is under your control.
de83c885-33b1-4f12-8a0a-d58cdb732631.author: Marcus Aurelius

4656d785-4058-4632-995b-46638d84e3fb.text: Remember: Matter. How tiny your share of it. Time. How brief and fleeting your allotment of it. Fate. How small a role you play in it.
4656d785-4058-4632-995b-46638d84e3fb.author: Marcus Aurelius

888faed5-a1b4-4ea8-92c9-45b08ebb8d66.text: Remember: philosophy requires only what your nature already demands.
888faed5-a1b4-4ea8-92c9-45b08ebb8d66.author: Marcus Aurelius

d9522fdd-0fa5-49a4-9eea-0eb1bf3204c1.text: Remember: philosophy requires only what your nature already demands. What you’ve been after is something else again—something unnatural.
d9522fdd-0fa5-49a4-9eea-0eb1bf3204c1.author: Marcus Aurelius

f0834d07-f59d-4a60-ab5c-9c99507a8c6d.text: Retire into thyself. The rational principle which rules has this nature, that it is content with itself when it does what is just, and so secures tranquility.
f0834d07-f59d-4a60-ab5c-9c99507a8c6d.author: Marcus Aurelius

4cfb5f38-75ca-4d7c-b837-6e9b24796e56.text: Set aside a certain number of days, during which you shall be content with the scantiest and cheapest fare, with coarse and rough dress, saying to yourself the while: "Is this the condition that I feared?"
4cfb5f38-75ca-4d7c-b837-6e9b24796e56.author: Marcus Aurelius

af30a5ff-6537-4e1d-a161-b512d729a9d8.text: Sexual ecstasy is like death. It is one of the secrets of nature’s wisdom.
af30a5ff-6537-4e1d-a161-b512d729a9d8.author: Marcus Aurelius

5964822a-3c3b-45df-a228-b44919336bdb.text: Similarly, man is born for deeds of kindness; and when he has done a kindly action, or otherwise served the common welfare, he has done what he was made for, and has received his quittance.
5964822a-3c3b-45df-a228-b44919336bdb.author: Marcus Aurelius

6947b37a-965c-4b1c-896d-84fa09439148.text: Since it is possible that thou mayest depart from life this very moment, regulate every act and thought accordingly.
6947b37a-965c-4b1c-896d-84fa09439148.author: Marcus Aurelius

b4e73179-5b08-42da-b779-d0c9374e8d3f.text: Since it is possible that you might depart from life this very moment, regulate every act and thought accordingly.
b4e73179-5b08-42da-b779-d0c9374e8d3f.author: Marcus Aurelius

91f23740-53be-4744-ba08-21c464670cd1.text: Sixth, consider when thou art much vexed or grieved, that man's life is only a moment, and after a short time we are all laid out dead.
91f23740-53be-4744-ba08-21c464670cd1.author: Marcus Aurelius

8f278e08-93f9-4432-a713-609e81c3dec8.text: So here is a rule to remember in future, when anything tempts you to feel bitter: not, ‘This is a misfortune,’ but ‘To bear this worthily is good fortune.
8f278e08-93f9-4432-a713-609e81c3dec8.author: Marcus Aurelius

cc0019a2-d59a-42bf-9d83-1a7a22a21020.text: So other people hurt me? That’s their problem. Their character and actions are not mine.
cc0019a2-d59a-42bf-9d83-1a7a22a21020.author: Marcus Aurelius

20c8f36b-ae59-4c70-b6ca-93b292cc9dd0.text: So other people hurt me? That’s their problem. Their character and actions are not mine. What is done to me is ordained by nature, what I do by my own.
20c8f36b-ae59-4c70-b6ca-93b292cc9dd0.author: Marcus Aurelius

5e1127d0-0d7d-49f6-8186-ae50e632591a.text: So remember this principle when something threatens to cause you pain: the thing itself was no misfortune at all; to endure it and prevail is great good fortune.
5e1127d0-0d7d-49f6-8186-ae50e632591a.author: Marcus Aurelius

5b3fee42-62db-4d72-b03b-f26b45bee70a.text: Some things are hurrying into existence, and others are hurrying out of it.
5b3fee42-62db-4d72-b03b-f26b45bee70a.author: Marcus Aurelius

c0a98ccb-36fa-4ea0-ad34-7d6ed2176f37.text: Soon you'll be ashes or bones. A mere name at most - and even that is just a sound, an echo. The things we want in life are empty, stale, trivial.
c0a98ccb-36fa-4ea0-ad34-7d6ed2176f37.author: Marcus Aurelius

ee46063a-8686-4f65-95e8-ed2b60bcb494.text: Soon, you will have forgotten everything.  Soon, everybody will have forgotten you.
ee46063a-8686-4f65-95e8-ed2b60bcb494.author: Marcus Aurelius

48594a03-9388-4d53-ac33-0990c813451b.text: Spend not the remnant of thy days in thoughts and fancies concerning other men, when it is not in relation to some common good, when by it thou art hindered from some other better work.
48594a03-9388-4d53-ac33-0990c813451b.author: Marcus Aurelius

087ce6ff-683f-4c73-946c-ae7a6eea4eb0.text: Still remember that no man loses any other life than this which he now lives, nor lives any other than this which he now loses.
087ce6ff-683f-4c73-946c-ae7a6eea4eb0.author: Marcus Aurelius

b31fc49c-4f02-40ea-9592-0221153bb1c1.text: Stoics held that material objects alone existed; but immanent in the material universe was a spiritual force which acted through them, manifesting itself under many forms, as fire, aether, spirit, soul, reason, the ruling principle.
b31fc49c-4f02-40ea-9592-0221153bb1c1.author: Marcus Aurelius

72502afb-ffa1-41ae-9c16-8fa7c582b14b.text: Stop allowing your mind to be a slave, to be jerked about by selfish impulses, to kick against fate and the present, and to mistrust the future.
72502afb-ffa1-41ae-9c16-8fa7c582b14b.author: Marcus Aurelius

de25f6d2-03a4-45cf-8638-19467ca8884a.text: Stop whatever you’re doing for a moment and ask yourself: Am I afraid of death because I won’t be able to do this anymore?
de25f6d2-03a4-45cf-8638-19467ca8884a.author: Marcus Aurelius

f0a38763-2bd0-41d6-aed5-265d461f51f3.text: Studying philosophy instills modesty and straightforwardness in your character.
f0a38763-2bd0-41d6-aed5-265d461f51f3.author: Marcus Aurelius

54f37716-9ffe-45c6-9ffd-ba1c6607e12c.text: Stupidity is expecting figs in winter, or children in old age.
54f37716-9ffe-45c6-9ffd-ba1c6607e12c.author: Marcus Aurelius

719ad071-0f93-4be7-a6f0-b37d3d8a128f.text: Such as are your habitual thoughts, such also will be the character of your mind; for the soul is dyed by the thoughts.
719ad071-0f93-4be7-a6f0-b37d3d8a128f.author: Marcus Aurelius

20da0d24-0743-4d31-be47-48fb325cc97d.text: Such as you are your habitual thoughts, such also will be the character of your mind; for your soul is dyed through the thoughts.
20da0d24-0743-4d31-be47-48fb325cc97d.author: Marcus Aurelius

3ce3b45f-3e7a-4ce2-9975-90f3eb9a0bfa.text: Swiftly the remembrance of all things is buried in the gulf of eternity.
3ce3b45f-3e7a-4ce2-9975-90f3eb9a0bfa.author: Marcus Aurelius

e34661ba-1f22-4bfa-a9ba-cbc7dede1d45.text: Take away thy opinion, and then there is taken away the complaint, “I have been harmed.” Take away the complaint, “I have been harmed,” and the harm is taken away.
e34661ba-1f22-4bfa-a9ba-cbc7dede1d45.author: Marcus Aurelius

41b3e6d5-c2f6-4da4-a389-26dda2613bb8.text: Take full account of what Excellencies you possess, and in gratitude remember how you would hanker after them, if you had them not.
41b3e6d5-c2f6-4da4-a389-26dda2613bb8.author: Marcus Aurelius

fef853e6-1925-44d4-b434-086d8cda77e1.text: Take pleasure in one thing and rest in it, in passing from one social act to another social act, thinking of God.
fef853e6-1925-44d4-b434-086d8cda77e1.author: Marcus Aurelius

2c983a5f-d054-4361-aae8-67cb7ac0a459.text: Take the shortest route, the one that nature planned—to speak and act in the healthiest way. Do that, and be free of pain and stress, free of all calculation and pretension.
2c983a5f-d054-4361-aae8-67cb7ac0a459.author: Marcus Aurelius

d2fc1572-ccad-4360-94dc-73f4c7797c29.text: That all is as thinking makes it so – and you control your thinking. So remove your judgements whenever you wish and then there is calm - as the sailor rounding the cape finds smooth water and the welcome of a waveless bay.
d2fc1572-ccad-4360-94dc-73f4c7797c29.author: Marcus Aurelius

693b8e12-9829-4f9e-adbd-44c878c9465a.text: That I have such a wife, so obedient.
693b8e12-9829-4f9e-adbd-44c878c9465a.author: Marcus Aurelius

8ea04654-8ab3-4a5b-9bac-3172cb83efa4.text: That there is but a certain limit of time appointed unto thee, which if thou shalt not make use of to calm and allay the many distempers of thy soul, it will pass away and thou with it, and never after return.
8ea04654-8ab3-4a5b-9bac-3172cb83efa4.author: Marcus Aurelius

da4a3771-a2be-450e-8f8a-f5bbc08cfb2a.text: That to expect bad people not to injure others is crazy. It's to ask the impossible. And to let them behave like that to other people but expect them to exempt you is arrogant--the act of a tyrant.
da4a3771-a2be-450e-8f8a-f5bbc08cfb2a.author: Marcus Aurelius

0969caa3-8e84-48d6-972b-a8a9d62c32e5.text: That way you'll see human life for what it is. Smoke. Nothing. Especially when you recall that once things alter they cease to exist through all the endless years to come. Then why such turmoil?
0969caa3-8e84-48d6-972b-a8a9d62c32e5.author: Marcus Aurelius

35d5cf05-d320-408d-b63f-afbe04528a71.text: That whenever I felt like helping someone who was short of money, or otherwise in need, I never had to be told that I had no resources to do it with. And that I was never put in that position myself—of having to take something from someone else.
35d5cf05-d320-408d-b63f-afbe04528a71.author: Marcus Aurelius

1c8b02c2-66e0-4c17-8f30-8a3543553d53.text: That which has died falls not out of the universe. If it stays here, it also changes here, and is dissolved into its proper parts, which are elements of the universe and of thyself. And these too change, and they murmur not.
1c8b02c2-66e0-4c17-8f30-8a3543553d53.author: Marcus Aurelius

548ea52e-1a8d-42ff-bf46-538dbab565a1.text: That which is not good for the bee-hive, cannot be good for the bee.
548ea52e-1a8d-42ff-bf46-538dbab565a1.author: Marcus Aurelius

aa57e78c-bd24-4104-b034-a216519fa41a.text: That which is not good for the swarm, neither is it good for the bee.
aa57e78c-bd24-4104-b034-a216519fa41a.author: Marcus Aurelius

8286dc11-eb39-474c-988c-96f1dbe6003f.text: That which is really beautiful has no need of anything; not more than law, not more than truth, not more than benevolence or modesty.
8286dc11-eb39-474c-988c-96f1dbe6003f.author: Marcus Aurelius

c3f12a47-c799-493e-bcc7-83526062ee4c.text: That you don’t know for sure it is a mistake. A lot of things are means to some other end. You have to know an awful lot before you can judge other people’s actions with real understanding.
c3f12a47-c799-493e-bcc7-83526062ee4c.author: Marcus Aurelius

aafc9d33-170d-430f-86ff-ef00dc9a36e8.text: The ambitious supposeth another man's act, praise and applause, to be his own happiness; the voluptuous his own sense and feeling; but he that is wise, his own action.
aafc9d33-170d-430f-86ff-ef00dc9a36e8.author: Marcus Aurelius

ca297144-ab5e-4dd6-b482-e9fbd6f958b5.text: The art of living is more like wrestling than dancing, in as much as it, too, demands a from and watchful stance against any unexpected onset.
ca297144-ab5e-4dd6-b482-e9fbd6f958b5.author: Marcus Aurelius

97d9eaea-bc67-4ca4-b91a-24bc966a4c33.text: The art of living is more like wrestling than dancing, in so far as it stands ready against the accidental and the unforeseen, and is not apt to fall.
97d9eaea-bc67-4ca4-b91a-24bc966a4c33.author: Marcus Aurelius

2bc2d912-e05f-4543-80fa-70da91180a3f.text: The best kind of revenge is not to become like them.
2bc2d912-e05f-4543-80fa-70da91180a3f.author: Marcus Aurelius

87ab0101-6643-4e60-acb2-9966688e1f43.text: The best revenge is not to be like that.
87ab0101-6643-4e60-acb2-9966688e1f43.author: Marcus Aurelius

4bd6d125-c72b-4ee2-8f04-e37b1cc8a907.text: The best revenge is not to do as they do.
4bd6d125-c72b-4ee2-8f04-e37b1cc8a907.author: Marcus Aurelius

681c2d32-d791-43d5-b72b-8dbfb7ea23fd.text: The best revenge is to be unlike him who performed the injury.
681c2d32-d791-43d5-b72b-8dbfb7ea23fd.author: Marcus Aurelius

86ada95a-632c-47a7-b1b5-2f6505dd2fca.text: The blazing fire makes flames and brightness out of everything thrown into it.
86ada95a-632c-47a7-b1b5-2f6505dd2fca.author: Marcus Aurelius

3ecbad3f-a686-4b02-9692-1779dd8bd962.text: The body and its parts are a river, the soul a dream and mist, life is warfare and a journey far from home, lasting reputation is oblivion.
3ecbad3f-a686-4b02-9692-1779dd8bd962.author: Marcus Aurelius

72c28f88-e14d-45bd-bd8c-ef4c7d0fb79e.text: The earth, saith the poet, doth often long after the rain. So is the glorious sky often as desirous to fall upon the earth, which argues a mutual kind of love between them.
72c28f88-e14d-45bd-bd8c-ef4c7d0fb79e.author: Marcus Aurelius

f4f8b53d-678c-4baf-8cfc-2221f3d74339.text: The existence of evil does not harm the world. And an individual act of evil does not harm the victim. Only one person is harmed by it—and he can stop being harmed as soon as he decides to.
f4f8b53d-678c-4baf-8cfc-2221f3d74339.author: Marcus Aurelius

8487cec1-c08d-43e5-94ab-905097f68349.text: The fencer’s weapon is picked up and put down again. The boxer’s is part of him. All he has to do is clench his fist.
8487cec1-c08d-43e5-94ab-905097f68349.author: Marcus Aurelius

f585e70f-bb97-4bdf-8b1e-f69bff5cd9d0.text: The first rule is to keep an untroubled spirit. The second is to look things in the face and know them for what they are.
f585e70f-bb97-4bdf-8b1e-f69bff5cd9d0.author: Marcus Aurelius

71528729-68f5-40e8-85f8-400e930bc6ad.text: The freedom to do only what God wants, and accept whatever God sends us.
71528729-68f5-40e8-85f8-400e930bc6ad.author: Marcus Aurelius

dbc92600-1aad-407d-957e-11b8b8e87a6e.text: The happiness and unhappiness of the rational, social animal depends not on what he feels but on what he does; just as his virtue and vice consist not in feeling but in doing.
dbc92600-1aad-407d-957e-11b8b8e87a6e.author: Marcus Aurelius

65f52790-280e-41cd-b6ae-c7cde3ce3548.text: The happiness of those who want to be popular depends on others; the happiness of those who seek pleasure fluctuates with moods outside their control; but the happiness of the wise grows out of their own free acts.
65f52790-280e-41cd-b6ae-c7cde3ce3548.author: Marcus Aurelius

d1ed4901-2bc2-49b0-b15c-6abfa51eb462.text: The happiness of your life depends upon the quality of your thoughts.
d1ed4901-2bc2-49b0-b15c-6abfa51eb462.author: Marcus Aurelius

9bbc245d-475f-4596-994d-db1d4325d064.text: The happiness of your life depends upon the quality of your thoughts: therefore, guard accordingly, and take care that you entertain no notions unsuitable to virtue and reasonable nature.
9bbc245d-475f-4596-994d-db1d4325d064.author: Marcus Aurelius

8a9666c0-f183-4cbf-8cd8-1a3ca0624a97.text: The happiness of your life depends upon the quality of your thoughts; therefore guard accordingly.
8a9666c0-f183-4cbf-8cd8-1a3ca0624a97.author: Marcus Aurelius

fee7939b-dc4f-44dd-bdb2-1b0aad40cade.text: The highest good of man is consciously to work with God for the common good, and this is the sense in which the Stoic tried to live in accord with nature.
fee7939b-dc4f-44dd-bdb2-1b0aad40cade.author: Marcus Aurelius

b0f48589-4910-44d5-b9e2-f596ed96c390.text: The honest and good man ought to be exactly like a man who smells strong, so that the bystander as soon as he comes near him must smell whether he choose or not.
b0f48589-4910-44d5-b9e2-f596ed96c390.author: Marcus Aurelius

eb0c0fdb-049b-44cf-a0d4-2f9660b3d2fe.text: The impediment to action advances action. What stands in the way becomes the way.
eb0c0fdb-049b-44cf-a0d4-2f9660b3d2fe.author: Marcus Aurelius

ab5e6d66-ed50-4704-be69-76a15025b591.text: The man of ambition thinks to find his good in the operations of others; the man of pleasure in his own sensations; but the man of understanding in his own actions.
ab5e6d66-ed50-4704-be69-76a15025b591.author: Marcus Aurelius

53c1cfc7-2e64-4126-9be8-2645e42417a6.text: The memory of everything is very soon overwhelmed in time.
53c1cfc7-2e64-4126-9be8-2645e42417a6.author: Marcus Aurelius

4d4b972c-cf3a-4fbc-89ae-996bdb5ee44e.text: The mind adapts and converts to its own purposes the obstacle to our acting. The impediment to action advances action. What stands in the way becomes the way.
4d4b972c-cf3a-4fbc-89ae-996bdb5ee44e.author: Marcus Aurelius

592dbfb4-849c-4140-9411-00b66842a405.text: The mind is that which is roused and directed by itself. It makes of itself what it chooses. It makes what it chooses of its own experience.
592dbfb4-849c-4140-9411-00b66842a405.author: Marcus Aurelius

15d0e0cd-27bf-49cf-845a-785d7b20d35e.text: The nearer a man comes to a calm mind, the closer he is to strength.
15d0e0cd-27bf-49cf-845a-785d7b20d35e.author: Marcus Aurelius

88977046-2777-4c27-8341-914d7722b1a2.text: The object of life is not to be on the side of the majority, but to escape finding oneself in the ranks of the insane.
88977046-2777-4c27-8341-914d7722b1a2.author: Marcus Aurelius

fa84044c-4651-41af-a141-858563f6796d.text: The offender needs pity, not wrath; those who must needs be corrected, should be treated with tact and gentleness; and one must be always ready to learn better. 'The best kind of revenge is, not to become like unto them.
fa84044c-4651-41af-a141-858563f6796d.author: Marcus Aurelius

3f825e2b-c456-47b8-8d95-724ce1fa2ba9.text: The other is that all these things, which thou seest, change immediately and will no longer be; and constantly bear in mind how many of these changes thou hast already witnessed. The universe is transformation: life is opinion.
3f825e2b-c456-47b8-8d95-724ce1fa2ba9.author: Marcus Aurelius

88b8aaa6-b632-4322-83fe-715c75a738f7.text: The perfection of moral character consists in this, in passing every day as the last, and in being neither violently excited nor torpid nor playing the hypocrite.
88b8aaa6-b632-4322-83fe-715c75a738f7.author: Marcus Aurelius

39a20f41-014f-424e-97c1-27cd56747017.text: The pomps and glories which he despised were all his; what to most men is an ambition or a dream, to him was a round of weary tasks which nothing but the stern sense of duty could carry him through. And he did his work well.
39a20f41-014f-424e-97c1-27cd56747017.author: Marcus Aurelius

92a2a8fb-a4a1-4d12-ba2e-3440a32ae548.text: The present is all that they can give up, since that is all you have, and what you do not have, you cannot lose.
92a2a8fb-a4a1-4d12-ba2e-3440a32ae548.author: Marcus Aurelius

0c561bb7-12c1-4ab4-ba26-ab7cc2daefbf.text: The present moment is the only thing of which anyone can be deprived, at least if this is the only thing he has and he cannot lose what he has not got.
0c561bb7-12c1-4ab4-ba26-ab7cc2daefbf.author: Marcus Aurelius

77b3e0cb-3c31-4a9c-b5c6-1295ee232cf1.text: The pride which is proud of want of pride is the most intolerable of all.
77b3e0cb-3c31-4a9c-b5c6-1295ee232cf1.author: Marcus Aurelius

3b520ca5-ae21-4e89-91d4-0cc3e28c3b1d.text: The Roman religion was in fact of the nature of a bargain: men paid certain sacrifices and rites, and the gods granted their favour, irrespective of right or wrong.
3b520ca5-ae21-4e89-91d4-0cc3e28c3b1d.author: Marcus Aurelius

753b8131-0757-43fc-b32f-14f1877d22d6.text: The ruler must be a philosopher as well as a king; and he must govern unwillingly, because he loves philosophy better than dominion.
753b8131-0757-43fc-b32f-14f1877d22d6.author: Marcus Aurelius

3d6494fd-141b-4874-8b45-3e79b72a5555.text: The sexual embrace can only be compared with music and with prayer.
3d6494fd-141b-4874-8b45-3e79b72a5555.author: Marcus Aurelius

5cbd6cf5-4187-4783-a193-aabb328262b9.text: The soul becomes dyed with the colour of its thoughts.
5cbd6cf5-4187-4783-a193-aabb328262b9.author: Marcus Aurelius

9634f961-7d2f-4f25-b899-7a0f59a997cf.text: The soul becomes dyed with the colours of its thoughts.
9634f961-7d2f-4f25-b899-7a0f59a997cf.author: Marcus Aurelius

0354e0e6-a5e0-4b07-b29c-58af2f30a6c2.text: The Stoic makes no differentiation between a small act of kindness by a simple person and a great act of virtue from a learned sage. Virtue is virtue, and in both cases the result is happiness for the one who is virtuous.
0354e0e6-a5e0-4b07-b29c-58af2f30a6c2.author: Marcus Aurelius

82614c08-67b1-4711-8afd-5223dba0a27e.text: The Stoics had always approved of participation in public life, and this stand struck a chord with the Roman aristocracy, whose code of values placed a premium on political and military activity.
82614c08-67b1-4711-8afd-5223dba0a27e.author: Marcus Aurelius

2db5e83d-7442-43a0-9524-cdffa95637f0.text: The student as boxer, not fencer. The fencer’s weapon is picked up and put down again. The boxer’s is part of him. All he has to do is clench his fist.
2db5e83d-7442-43a0-9524-cdffa95637f0.author: Marcus Aurelius

f8e1bde3-af94-41dd-a170-446b8fe6bc8b.text: The thing itself was no misfortune at all; to endure it and prevail is great good fortune.
f8e1bde3-af94-41dd-a170-446b8fe6bc8b.author: Marcus Aurelius

62e5fa66-9e8c-47fe-a878-113b51df1cd9.text: The things ordained for you—teach yourself to be at one with those. And the people who share them with you—treat them with love. With real love.
62e5fa66-9e8c-47fe-a878-113b51df1cd9.author: Marcus Aurelius

01bcb868-90ee-433a-9150-727477c63fc8.text: The things you think about determine the quality of your mind.
01bcb868-90ee-433a-9150-727477c63fc8.author: Marcus Aurelius

4e5d891c-afd0-4345-8613-ef419cf4f164.text: The things you think about determine the quality of your mind. Your soul takes on the color of your thoughts.
4e5d891c-afd0-4345-8613-ef419cf4f164.author: Marcus Aurelius

50c3a624-c1de-4bee-be69-61d44c72c887.text: The time is at hand when you will have forgotten everything; and the time is at hand when all will have forgotten you. Always reflect that soon you will be no one, and nowhere.
50c3a624-c1de-4bee-be69-61d44c72c887.author: Marcus Aurelius

b3e1a23a-9a34-4b5b-b4b2-dbb9275e4d50.text: The tranquillity that comes when you stop caring what they say. Or think, or do. Only what you do. (Is this fair? Is this the right thing to do?)  . . .  not to be distracted by their darkness. To run straight for the finish line, unswerving.
b3e1a23a-9a34-4b5b-b4b2-dbb9275e4d50.author: Marcus Aurelius

de16160f-12ce-4a3e-8d6b-286ef6ecde32.text: The universe is change, and life mere opinion.
de16160f-12ce-4a3e-8d6b-286ef6ecde32.author: Marcus Aurelius

ba268094-3c78-45c4-b407-f589f91bdd5d.text: The universe is change; life is your perception of it.
ba268094-3c78-45c4-b407-f589f91bdd5d.author: Marcus Aurelius

d41e4ce6-e2fd-450e-bd66-2b1465a18eff.text: The universe is change; our life is what our thoughts make it.
d41e4ce6-e2fd-450e-bd66-2b1465a18eff.author: Marcus Aurelius

89442e4c-164c-419f-86f2-c9933733adc0.text: The universe is flux, life is opinion.
89442e4c-164c-419f-86f2-c9933733adc0.author: Marcus Aurelius

a5669f82-30e5-4727-8efb-79b49a6b84ee.text: The universe is transformation; life is opinion.
a5669f82-30e5-4727-8efb-79b49a6b84ee.author: Marcus Aurelius

c273a046-515e-4e69-9da9-85ea941fb56a.text: The universe, then, is God, of whom the popular gods are manifestations; while legends and myths are allegorical. The soul of man is thus an emanation from the godhead, into whom it will eventually be re-absorbed.
c273a046-515e-4e69-9da9-85ea941fb56a.author: Marcus Aurelius

99016007-0ff2-4aa1-abfd-e0efda599b1e.text: The value of attentiveness varies in proportion to its object. You’re better off not giving the small things more time than they deserve.
99016007-0ff2-4aa1-abfd-e0efda599b1e.author: Marcus Aurelius

420b6beb-05bd-4591-8f16-670a7df430bb.text: The way to peace is to be content with yourself, honor the light of reason within, live in harmony with others, and be grateful to the gods for the universe and your role in it.
420b6beb-05bd-4591-8f16-670a7df430bb.author: Marcus Aurelius

2431b20c-1158-4e17-abca-4f2a7e6032e8.text: The whole universe is change and life itself is but what you deem it.
2431b20c-1158-4e17-abca-4f2a7e6032e8.author: Marcus Aurelius

042b6131-8c5f-411c-b9c9-b515d793aa69.text: The whole Universe is change, and life itself is but what you deem it.
042b6131-8c5f-411c-b9c9-b515d793aa69.author: Marcus Aurelius

024d1bfd-e1c7-46e2-90fa-f7b824dffa70.text: The world is maintained by change—in the elements and in the things they compose.
024d1bfd-e1c7-46e2-90fa-f7b824dffa70.author: Marcus Aurelius

fefb3e60-d535-454b-82bc-06e3bfd1b3c1.text: The world is mere change, and this life, opinion.
fefb3e60-d535-454b-82bc-06e3bfd1b3c1.author: Marcus Aurelius

db282061-3bce-44fe-a7a9-dbe816a488aa.text: The world is nothing but change. Our life is only perception.
db282061-3bce-44fe-a7a9-dbe816a488aa.author: Marcus Aurelius

c6718d57-9bf5-4944-8082-d3ac6395d5e0.text: Then consider the Middle (and later the New) Comedy and what it aimed at—gradually degenerating into mere realism and empty technique.
c6718d57-9bf5-4944-8082-d3ac6395d5e0.author: Marcus Aurelius

09e69a11-8f44-460d-85b6-11e29c54ea9d.text: There is a kind of river of things passing into being and Time is a violent torrent. For no sooner is each seen, than it has been carried away, and another is being carried by, and that, too, will be carried away.
09e69a11-8f44-460d-85b6-11e29c54ea9d.author: Marcus Aurelius

212e102f-787f-420c-9d86-81aacca389a9.text: There is no man so blessed that some who stand by his deathbed won't hail the occasion with delight.
212e102f-787f-420c-9d86-81aacca389a9.author: Marcus Aurelius

3b28a12e-5f0d-40d5-8883-a9aadb01b818.text: There is nothing more shameful than perfidious friendship.
3b28a12e-5f0d-40d5-8883-a9aadb01b818.author: Marcus Aurelius

5d6bb5c9-f77c-4ce1-8fca-26d146a48e3e.text: Thereby gain much leisure, and save much trouble, and therefore at every action a man must privately by way of admonition suggest unto himself, What? may not this that now I go about.
5d6bb5c9-f77c-4ce1-8fca-26d146a48e3e.author: Marcus Aurelius

dbac63d8-7484-442b-83ae-b61c4414a990.text: There’s nothing more insufferable than people who boast about their own humility.
dbac63d8-7484-442b-83ae-b61c4414a990.author: Marcus Aurelius

aba5fb15-0bf6-4287-95e9-d40665749b9b.text: They contemn one another, and yet they seek to please one another: and whilest they seek to surpass one another in worldly pomp and greatness, they most debase and prostitute themselves in their better part one to another.
aba5fb15-0bf6-4287-95e9-d40665749b9b.author: Marcus Aurelius

4d8a0c4c-cd16-4d2d-8a11-73dac5b5fdd8.text: They despise one another, yet they flatter one another;they sant to get above another and get they bow down to one another.
4d8a0c4c-cd16-4d2d-8a11-73dac5b5fdd8.author: Marcus Aurelius

30e95d8f-492a-485a-a2ec-010269ee8954.text: Things of themselves cannot touch the soul at all. They have no entry to the soul, and cannot turn or move it. The soul alone turns and moves itself, making all externals presented to it cohere with the judgements it thinks worthy of itself.
30e95d8f-492a-485a-a2ec-010269ee8954.author: Marcus Aurelius

4f143881-2685-4603-bd5e-df571b62799e.text: Things: and the vanity of praise, and the inconstancy.
4f143881-2685-4603-bd5e-df571b62799e.author: Marcus Aurelius

857855c0-82e9-4688-83f5-467c8aa8008e.text: Things?—I was once a fortunate man, but I lost it, I know not how.—But fortunate means that a man has assigned to himself a good fortune: and a good fortune is good disposition of the soul, good emotions, good actions.
857855c0-82e9-4688-83f5-467c8aa8008e.author: Marcus Aurelius

407ef7b0-f02c-4f03-91e7-1c712752bb5b.text: Think not so much of what you lack as of what you have: but of the things that you have, select the best, and then reflect on how eagerly you would have sought them if you did not have them.
407ef7b0-f02c-4f03-91e7-1c712752bb5b.author: Marcus Aurelius

dae2d041-5e73-430b-8449-36504bd65acf.text: Think of the countless changes in which you yourself have bad a part. The whole universe is change, and life is but what you deem it.
dae2d041-5e73-430b-8449-36504bd65acf.author: Marcus Aurelius

71b84be0-0903-48bc-95e8-5db40e451095.text: Think of the universal substance, of which thou has a very small portion; and of universal time, of which a short and indivisible interval has been assigned to thee; and of that which is fixed by destiny, and how small a part of it thou art.
71b84be0-0903-48bc-95e8-5db40e451095.author: Marcus Aurelius

16705a57-e763-449e-a934-45d78395f372.text: Think of yourself as dead. You have lived your life. Now take what's left and live it properly.
16705a57-e763-449e-a934-45d78395f372.author: Marcus Aurelius

784a7027-e82c-4e4e-9072-db2c3d4961a5.text: Think of yourself as dead. You have lived your life. Now take what’s left and live it properly.
784a7027-e82c-4e4e-9072-db2c3d4961a5.author: Marcus Aurelius

be9bbd44-eb81-4135-8080-5e4fc6858eda.text: Think of yourself as dead. You have lived your life. Now, take what's left and live it properly. What doesn't transmit light creates its own darkness.
be9bbd44-eb81-4135-8080-5e4fc6858eda.author: Marcus Aurelius

fbf5e2bf-d79b-4006-b76f-9a8d0e8d9843.text: Think often the connection of all things in the world and their mutual relations, they are arguably intertwined with each other and thus have for each other a mutual friendship, and that under the connection that leads him and the unity of matter.
fbf5e2bf-d79b-4006-b76f-9a8d0e8d9843.author: Marcus Aurelius

b51d347e-1bd9-4102-ac38-9bdca3ea2114.text: This that I am, whatever it be, is mere flesh and a little breath and the ruling Reason.
b51d347e-1bd9-4102-ac38-9bdca3ea2114.author: Marcus Aurelius

e59f5147-897d-4052-a894-b0353849b30f.text: This then remains: Remember to retire into this little territory of thy own, and, above all, do not distract or strain thyself, but be free, at look and things as a man, as a human being, as a citizen, as a mortal.
e59f5147-897d-4052-a894-b0353849b30f.author: Marcus Aurelius

6146e65f-8768-4471-8d7d-dc3e1d0d8568.text: This thing, what is it in itself, in its own constitution? What is its substance and material?
6146e65f-8768-4471-8d7d-dc3e1d0d8568.author: Marcus Aurelius

f3aa0c7c-1a1d-4521-8023-25a73e69803c.text: This world is mere change, and this life, opinion.
f3aa0c7c-1a1d-4521-8023-25a73e69803c.author: Marcus Aurelius

1275d8d6-ba94-451e-b890-2495ec7db85c.text: Thou art a little soul bearing about a corpse, as Epictetus used to say. It is no evil for things to undergo change, and no good for things to subsist in consequence of change.
1275d8d6-ba94-451e-b890-2495ec7db85c.author: Marcus Aurelius

7590ec4d-3afd-4c23-9622-cbf2911dd44e.text: Thou art a little soul bearing about a corpse.
7590ec4d-3afd-4c23-9622-cbf2911dd44e.author: Marcus Aurelius

966c895d-f86b-4f29-bb3f-f367c5de0c2d.text: Thou art an old man; no longer let this be a slave, no longer be pulled by the strings like a puppet to unsocial movements, no longer either be dissatisfied with thy present lot, or shrink from the future.
966c895d-f86b-4f29-bb3f-f367c5de0c2d.author: Marcus Aurelius

30b1b12c-dcab-4efc-9066-eb92894607b6.text: Thou must be like a promontory of the sea, against which though the waves beat continually, yet it both itself stands, and about it are those swelling waves stilled and quieted.
30b1b12c-dcab-4efc-9066-eb92894607b6.author: Marcus Aurelius

29ebecf7-6948-4fae-8c46-48444cce1643.text: Thou wilt cease to be held by pains and pleasures, and to be a slave to the vessel, which is as much inferior as that which serves it is superior: for the one is intelligence and deity; the other is earth and corruption.
29ebecf7-6948-4fae-8c46-48444cce1643.author: Marcus Aurelius

c87ba07e-7447-4cb4-acaf-1f40f9fb4cdc.text: Though thou shouldst be going to live three thousand years, and as many times ten thousand years, still remember that no man loses any other life than this which he now lives, nor lives any other than this which he now loses.
c87ba07e-7447-4cb4-acaf-1f40f9fb4cdc.author: Marcus Aurelius

b0d5b3e3-709d-4e41-a12b-d4c52b5eb746.text: Though you break your heart, men will go on as before.
b0d5b3e3-709d-4e41-a12b-d4c52b5eb746.author: Marcus Aurelius

285adc1b-9551-41b1-9b0d-f6fb3e6113f0.text: Thus the Stoics arrive at their main thesis. Virtue alone is admirable, virtue is absolutely self-sufficient; the good man needs no help from circumstances, neither sickness nor adversity can harm him; he is a king, a god among men.
285adc1b-9551-41b1-9b0d-f6fb3e6113f0.author: Marcus Aurelius

89d2f005-884a-4ae1-8fc3-b23a70910355.text: Thus thou must use to keep thyself to the first motions and apprehensions of things, as they present themselves outwardly; and add not unto them from within thyself through mere conceit and opinion.
89d2f005-884a-4ae1-8fc3-b23a70910355.author: Marcus Aurelius

693a5ea8-7e31-450d-bad8-155cc022852c.text: Time is a river, a violent current of events, glimpsed once and already carried past us, and another follows and is gone.
693a5ea8-7e31-450d-bad8-155cc022852c.author: Marcus Aurelius

872b7af5-35d6-4704-a00f-26163ed35fb4.text: Time is fixed for thee, which if thou dost not use for clearing away the clouds from thy mind, it will go and thou wilt go, and it will never return.
872b7af5-35d6-4704-a00f-26163ed35fb4.author: Marcus Aurelius

4a158d95-ac20-400b-9559-011e727a9195.text: Time is like a river made up of the events which happen, and a violent stream; for as soon as a thing has been seen, it is carried away, and another comes in its place, and this will be carried away too.
4a158d95-ac20-400b-9559-011e727a9195.author: Marcus Aurelius

6167ad68-f0aa-4f84-9334-c9ea7dacdbeb.text: To be like the rock that the waves keep crashing over. It stands unmoved and the raging of the sea falls still around it.
6167ad68-f0aa-4f84-9334-c9ea7dacdbeb.author: Marcus Aurelius

e4a93161-f6ed-4f3b-84d7-5789f280b6c3.text: To conclude, always observe how ephemeral and worthless human things are, and what was yesterday a little mucus tomorrow will be a mummy or ashes.
e4a93161-f6ed-4f3b-84d7-5789f280b6c3.author: Marcus Aurelius

1fad8a47-2c1d-4c67-9074-f3c49cbc11f2.text: To enter others’ minds and let them enter yours.
1fad8a47-2c1d-4c67-9074-f3c49cbc11f2.author: Marcus Aurelius

780156b0-3dec-4598-ac6d-12ad83e291fc.text: To grieve or be angry about or fear what happens to you is to be a fugitive from the law of nature.
780156b0-3dec-4598-ac6d-12ad83e291fc.author: Marcus Aurelius

ae17a861-1655-4e5b-ab5e-e6ddca5a5c93.text: To grumble at anything that happens is a rebellion against Nature, in some part of which are bound up the natures of all other things.
ae17a861-1655-4e5b-ab5e-e6ddca5a5c93.author: Marcus Aurelius

bedd1ee0-3d01-4613-ae13-8a2750f4c7f2.text: To how much envy and fraud and hypocrisy the state of a tyrannous king is subject unto, and how they who are commonly called, i.e. nobly born, are in some sort incapable, or void of natural affection.
bedd1ee0-3d01-4613-ae13-8a2750f4c7f2.author: Marcus Aurelius

1e370072-5d49-46b7-a250-1b6a1d4ca46d.text: To live happily is an inward power of the soul.
1e370072-5d49-46b7-a250-1b6a1d4ca46d.author: Marcus Aurelius

e2509c97-bd3f-46af-8252-463d4ef4447b.text: To love only what happens, what was destined. No greater harmony.
e2509c97-bd3f-46af-8252-463d4ef4447b.author: Marcus Aurelius

2bdfafbd-38bf-4870-a374-8f27e87da28d.text: To pass through this brief life as nature demands. To give it up without complaint. Like an olive that ripens and falls. Praising its mother, thanking the tree it grew on.
2bdfafbd-38bf-4870-a374-8f27e87da28d.author: Marcus Aurelius

7bbb07de-0046-47b0-859a-dfe0469a1bb8.text: To pursue the impossible is madness: but it is impossible for evil men not to do things of this sort.
7bbb07de-0046-47b0-859a-dfe0469a1bb8.author: Marcus Aurelius

017c449c-88d7-42d7-993e-56e640a74467.text: To pursue the unattainable is insanity, yet the thoughtless can never refrain from doing so.
017c449c-88d7-42d7-993e-56e640a74467.author: Marcus Aurelius

47d4b55c-86f4-434b-95b5-473bbae41528.text: To read with diligence; not to rest satisfied with a light and superficial knowledge, nor quickly to assent to things commonly spoken of.
47d4b55c-86f4-434b-95b5-473bbae41528.author: Marcus Aurelius

69c415e7-fd49-4b56-9682-378add240f7e.text: To read with diligence; not to rest satisfied with a light and superficial knowledge, nor quickly to assent to things commonly spoken of: whom.
69c415e7-fd49-4b56-9682-378add240f7e.author: Marcus Aurelius

cfcd8d8c-24c7-48bb-8c0c-d71d94f67411.text: To read with diligence; not to rest satisfied with a light and superficial knowledge, nor quickly to assent to things commonly spoken.
cfcd8d8c-24c7-48bb-8c0c-d71d94f67411.author: Marcus Aurelius

99c35b15-34bb-4117-8a32-02539bad870d.text: To recover your life is within your power; simply view things again as once you viewed them, for your revival rests in that.
99c35b15-34bb-4117-8a32-02539bad870d.author: Marcus Aurelius

03fc8312-6ab9-4a96-9004-6a1418554211.text: To refrain from imitation is the best revenge.
03fc8312-6ab9-4a96-9004-6a1418554211.author: Marcus Aurelius

647bc270-edba-4c3d-9db2-ca75cdd386d9.text: To say all in a word, everything which belongs to the body is a stream, and what belongs to the soul is a dream and vapour, and life is a warfare and a stranger’s sojourn, and after-fame is oblivion.
647bc270-edba-4c3d-9db2-ca75cdd386d9.author: Marcus Aurelius

3a2a4e60-efc9-43a5-924a-5775188850ff.text: To stand up straight — not straightened.
3a2a4e60-efc9-43a5-924a-5775188850ff.author: Marcus Aurelius

5d03ac60-8179-4a83-b8e0-00e3923c5e9f.text: To the best of my judgment, when I look at the human character I see no virtue placed there to counter justice. But I see one to counter pleasure: self-control.
5d03ac60-8179-4a83-b8e0-00e3923c5e9f.author: Marcus Aurelius

71ac23ab-f8af-4c6a-b3df-c6d7e5a993bc.text: To the gods I am indebted for having good grandfathers, good parents, a good sister, good teachers, good associates, good kinsmen and friends, nearly everything good.
71ac23ab-f8af-4c6a-b3df-c6d7e5a993bc.author: Marcus Aurelius

7f25f778-6ab9-484c-98b5-2d264c62b027.text: To the world: Your harmony is mine. Whatever time you choose is the right time. Not late, not early.
7f25f778-6ab9-484c-98b5-2d264c62b027.author: Marcus Aurelius

fac079b7-6e28-4a11-9b6c-4ea7418111db.text: To undertake nothing: i. at random or without a purpose; ii. for any reason but the common good.
fac079b7-6e28-4a11-9b6c-4ea7418111db.author: Marcus Aurelius

3b7e8f0a-dde4-4e1f-bbeb-9490397e7b15.text: Today I escaped all circumstance, or rather I cast out all circumstance, for it was not outside me, but within my judgements.
3b7e8f0a-dde4-4e1f-bbeb-9490397e7b15.author: Marcus Aurelius

625d83a2-5e31-4325-a671-0628c766f282.text: Today I escaped from anxiety. Or no, I discarded it, because it was within me, in my own perceptions—not outside.
625d83a2-5e31-4325-a671-0628c766f282.author: Marcus Aurelius

1e972bb0-b33f-4ade-9f17-94c3614ca6ba.text: Today I have got out of all trouble, or rather I have cast out all trouble, for it was not outside, but within and in my opinions.
1e972bb0-b33f-4ade-9f17-94c3614ca6ba.author: Marcus Aurelius

fc91d22e-2b3a-4a15-b056-ffe6bfde9b04.text: Tranquillity is nothing else than the good ordering of the mind.
fc91d22e-2b3a-4a15-b056-ffe6bfde9b04.author: Marcus Aurelius

96046448-0b0e-46da-994a-601bea3ab330.text: Try how the life of the good man suits thee, the life of him who is satisfied with his portion out of the whole, and satisfied with his own just acts and benevolent disposition.
96046448-0b0e-46da-994a-601bea3ab330.author: Marcus Aurelius

1e8de1e1-e65e-4fcf-acfa-dd64060f4607.text: Unhappy am I because this has happened to me. Not so, but happy am I, though this has happened to me, because I continue free from pain, neither crushed by the present nor fearing the future.
1e8de1e1-e65e-4fcf-acfa-dd64060f4607.author: Marcus Aurelius

5a8c334c-0361-4975-ab47-cc9adc4159fd.text: Use thyself even unto those things that thou doest at first despair of. For the left hand we see, which for the most part hieth idle because not used; yet doth it hold the bridle with more strength than the right, because it hath been used unto it.
5a8c334c-0361-4975-ab47-cc9adc4159fd.author: Marcus Aurelius

b8a421e5-36fa-4560-98d5-43a0f9ea9729.text: Very little is needed to make a happy life; it is all within yourself in your way of thinking.
b8a421e5-36fa-4560-98d5-43a0f9ea9729.author: Marcus Aurelius

9f602625-8dd8-4c6a-9b73-ca5c49b9aed7.text: Vex not thy spirit at the course of things,they not heed thy vexations.
9f602625-8dd8-4c6a-9b73-ca5c49b9aed7.author: Marcus Aurelius

ba323c0b-70e4-4705-a273-5c05f766587f.text: Wait for it patiently—annihilation or metamorphosis.
ba323c0b-70e4-4705-a273-5c05f766587f.author: Marcus Aurelius

dd3d3bde-17f3-44a2-94cb-8a15d367251d.text: Waste no more time arguing about what a good man should be. Be one.
dd3d3bde-17f3-44a2-94cb-8a15d367251d.author: Marcus Aurelius

2a33c37e-e62d-40f7-83e7-5e7e6b956ee0.text: Waste no more time arguing that a good man should be. Be one.
2a33c37e-e62d-40f7-83e7-5e7e6b956ee0.author: Marcus Aurelius

c5b448ce-2e79-44d0-aa21-df7d7ea07488.text: We are all mere nuggets of incense on the one altar. Some burn down now , some later - there is no difference .
c5b448ce-2e79-44d0-aa21-df7d7ea07488.author: Marcus Aurelius

4652214c-b862-4ebf-979b-1d15c33e0c49.text: We are the other of the other.
4652214c-b862-4ebf-979b-1d15c33e0c49.author: Marcus Aurelius

35a4f7fe-7510-4cef-b1d6-b5e01e9c4a99.text: We must make haste then, not only because we are daily nearer to death, but also because the conception of things and the understanding of them cease first.
35a4f7fe-7510-4cef-b1d6-b5e01e9c4a99.author: Marcus Aurelius

f81dea94-169c-491d-84ef-761df404f476.text: We must make haste, then, not only because we are daily nearer to death, but also because the conception of things and the understanding of them cease first.
f81dea94-169c-491d-84ef-761df404f476.author: Marcus Aurelius

55f1d147-1dfa-4864-bef5-9d75f63bdd5f.text: We ought to do good to others as simply as a horse runs, or a bee makes honey, or a vine bears grapes season after season without thinking of the grapes it has borne.
55f1d147-1dfa-4864-bef5-9d75f63bdd5f.author: Marcus Aurelius

30d57d4b-39ce-49ba-bd1b-37f69f8b27a8.text: We shrink from change; yet is there anything that can come into being without it?
30d57d4b-39ce-49ba-bd1b-37f69f8b27a8.author: Marcus Aurelius

cf38b5f2-d962-403f-a671-48ea06ec118d.text: We were made, Marcus tells us over and over, not for ourselves but for others, and our nature is fundamentally unselfish. In our relationships with others we must work for their collective good, while treating them justly and fairly as individuals.
cf38b5f2-d962-403f-a671-48ea06ec118d.author: Marcus Aurelius

7e3b6188-b3c4-44e5-a11a-fd011751443f.text: Were you to live three thousand years, or even thirty thousand, remember that the sole life which a man can lose is that which he is living at the moment; and furthermore, that he can have no other life except the one he loses.
7e3b6188-b3c4-44e5-a11a-fd011751443f.author: Marcus Aurelius

a19759f0-26e9-46f6-8dad-c1c1c897c9f5.text: What am I but a little flesh, a little breath, and the thinking part that rules the whole?
a19759f0-26e9-46f6-8dad-c1c1c897c9f5.author: Marcus Aurelius

7a88c3ad-40ee-449c-bb17-bf08dfff98de.text: What am I doing with my soul? Interrogate yourself, to find out what inhabits your so-called mind and what kind of soul you have now. A child’s soul, an adolescent’s, a woman’s? A tyrant’s soul? The soul of a predator—or its prey?
7a88c3ad-40ee-449c-bb17-bf08dfff98de.author: Marcus Aurelius

44a0ba09-1596-40c1-b974-11cd66693be3.text: What else did you expect from helping someone out? Isn’t it enough that you’ve done what your nature demands? You want a salary for it too? As if your eyes expected a reward for seeing, or your feet for walking. That’s what they were made for.
44a0ba09-1596-40c1-b974-11cd66693be3.author: Marcus Aurelius

4639df57-df18-4158-b72c-f26f7ab16763.text: What is divine deserves our respect because it is good; what is human deserves our affection because it is like us.
4639df57-df18-4158-b72c-f26f7ab16763.author: Marcus Aurelius

4a6f532f-21af-4c07-a35a-84d5392ff2f4.text: What is not good for the hive is no good for the bee.
4a6f532f-21af-4c07-a35a-84d5392ff2f4.author: Marcus Aurelius

48a082a4-feee-4154-b727-fe0f2fbb3c9e.text: What is this, fundamentally? What is its nature and substance, its reason for being? What is it doing in the world? How long is it here for?
48a082a4-feee-4154-b727-fe0f2fbb3c9e.author: Marcus Aurelius

0a07c072-4ce7-4a22-9465-e730edff6030.text: What we cannot bear removes us from life; what remains can be borne.
0a07c072-4ce7-4a22-9465-e730edff6030.author: Marcus Aurelius

475bf5fb-e46a-40a5-99cd-c59efa60a52c.text: What we do now echoes in eternity.
475bf5fb-e46a-40a5-99cd-c59efa60a52c.author: Marcus Aurelius

b999f5ef-b673-4329-95fb-ac6b8980ea17.text: Whatever anyone does or says, I must be emerald and keep my colour.
b999f5ef-b673-4329-95fb-ac6b8980ea17.author: Marcus Aurelius

7dd64bba-b4d5-4f06-8697-8f5dc362f676.text: Whatever anyone does or says, I must be good; just as if the emerald were always saying this: "Whatever anyone does or says, I must still be emerald, and keep my color."
7dd64bba-b4d5-4f06-8697-8f5dc362f676.author: Marcus Aurelius

47e0aada-d7f5-4e25-bf49-45cc240a8218.text: Whatever happens at all happens as it should; you will find this true, if you watch narrowly.
47e0aada-d7f5-4e25-bf49-45cc240a8218.author: Marcus Aurelius

b3d93340-4597-44f3-a804-4efe51670276.text: Whatever happens to every man, this is for the interest of the universal.
b3d93340-4597-44f3-a804-4efe51670276.author: Marcus Aurelius

2c08b946-ec39-4f3b-82b4-a357af59e258.text: Whatever happens to you has been waiting to happen since the beginning of time. The twining strands of fate wove both of them together: your own existence and the things that happen to you.
2c08b946-ec39-4f3b-82b4-a357af59e258.author: Marcus Aurelius

1c93b0aa-8ced-4972-b13d-d93b1b8455c8.text: Whatever happens, happens rightly. Watch closely, and you will find this true. In the succession of events there is not mere sequence alone, but an order that is just right, as from the hand of one who dispense to their due.
1c93b0aa-8ced-4972-b13d-d93b1b8455c8.author: Marcus Aurelius

8efa6f46-1e1b-4916-81df-cb7a02a791aa.text: Whatever is in any way beautiful hath its source of beauty in itself, and is complete in itself; praise forms no part of it. So it is none the worse nor the better for being praised.
8efa6f46-1e1b-4916-81df-cb7a02a791aa.author: Marcus Aurelius

0b031d30-688d-4230-9c90-651a56a949df.text: Whatever may happen to you, it was prepared for you from all eternity; and the implication of causes was from eternity spinning the thread of your being, and of that which is incident to it.
0b031d30-688d-4230-9c90-651a56a949df.author: Marcus Aurelius

45b31473-3b31-490b-8292-5caa46e6692b.text: Whatever time you choose is the right time. Not late, not early.
45b31473-3b31-490b-8292-5caa46e6692b.author: Marcus Aurelius

3bf6f1f4-355d-48a1-9976-984021140275.text: When force of circumstance upsets your equanimity, lose no time in recovering your self-control, and do not remain out of tune longer than you can help. Habitual recurrence to the harmony will increase your mastery of it.
3bf6f1f4-355d-48a1-9976-984021140275.author: Marcus Aurelius

23ce0159-c648-4e13-aa82-1de82319d97a.text: When it allows its action and impulse to be without a purpose, to be random and disconnected: even the smallest things ought to be directed toward a goal.
23ce0159-c648-4e13-aa82-1de82319d97a.author: Marcus Aurelius

a2c036ea-b849-40fd-bc9e-da95506cef45.text: When jarred, unavoidably, by circumstance, revert at once to yourself, and don’t lose the rhythm more than you can help. You’ll have a better group of harmony if you keep on going back to it.
a2c036ea-b849-40fd-bc9e-da95506cef45.author: Marcus Aurelius

8ed8fb08-e290-4385-8240-c17192136cbd.text: When men are inhuman, take care not to feel towards them as they do towards other humans.
8ed8fb08-e290-4385-8240-c17192136cbd.author: Marcus Aurelius

56e261da-1482-4b32-a8f0-36d81bf212f2.text: When the longest- and shortest-lived of us dies their loss is precisely equal. For the sole thing of which any of us can be deprived is the present, since this is all we own, and nobody can lose what is not theirs.
56e261da-1482-4b32-a8f0-36d81bf212f2.author: Marcus Aurelius

13f0369d-2131-4ccc-a269-40a771148f5f.text: When the object perishes, the pneuma that animated it is reabsorbed into the logos as a whole. This process of destruction and reintegration happens to individual objects at every moment.
13f0369d-2131-4ccc-a269-40a771148f5f.author: Marcus Aurelius

43760861-50b6-4e9b-8fc7-071e45162b29.text: When you are disturbed by events and lose your serenity, quickly return to yourself and don't stay upset longer than the experience lasts; for you'll have more mastery over your inner harmony by continually returning to it.
43760861-50b6-4e9b-8fc7-071e45162b29.author: Marcus Aurelius

53b5a7c1-c0ec-49b4-a511-42d8757e6671.text: When you are offended at any man’s fault, immediately turn to yourself and reflect in what manner you yourself have erred.
53b5a7c1-c0ec-49b4-a511-42d8757e6671.author: Marcus Aurelius

7dd072a6-478d-41a7-8d2c-3ffa23dfc621.text: When you arise in the moring, think of what a precious privelege it is to be alive-- to breathe, to think, to enjoy, to love.
7dd072a6-478d-41a7-8d2c-3ffa23dfc621.author: Marcus Aurelius

2cecab10-a632-4879-9ecf-8da20c75cf98.text: When you arise in the morning think of what a privilege it is to be alive, to think, to enjoy, to love ...
2cecab10-a632-4879-9ecf-8da20c75cf98.author: Marcus Aurelius

400556d4-0a23-41be-affb-02d7bdc03e47.text: When you arise in the morning, think of what a precious privilege it is to be alive-to breathe, to think, to enjoy, to love.
400556d4-0a23-41be-affb-02d7bdc03e47.author: Marcus Aurelius

cb5d6199-3ff1-4940-b1fc-e239f1bf1bcd.text: When you deal with irrational animals, with things and circumstances, be generous and straightforward. You are rational; they are not.
cb5d6199-3ff1-4940-b1fc-e239f1bf1bcd.author: Marcus Aurelius

3ca93d08-4376-46f3-8bc4-9fba8e10051e.text: When you have done a good act and another has received it, why do you look for a third thing besides these, as fools do, either to have the reputation of having done a good act or to obtain a return?
3ca93d08-4376-46f3-8bc4-9fba8e10051e.author: Marcus Aurelius

58312111-3c7b-4b52-bed4-3d8b6af86e0f.text: When you wake up in the morning, tell yourself: The people I deal with today will be meddling, ungrateful, arrogant, dishonest, jealous, and surly. They are like this because they can’t tell good from evil.
58312111-3c7b-4b52-bed4-3d8b6af86e0f.author: Marcus Aurelius

6a70273f-f014-4012-940c-6736f5a25bca.text: Whenever you are about to find fault with someone, ask yourself the following question: What fault of mine most nearly resembles the one I am about to criticize?
6a70273f-f014-4012-940c-6736f5a25bca.author: Marcus Aurelius

1a14eba7-37f2-4bb8-b063-d47939c9150d.text: Where a man can live, there he can also live well. But he must live in a palace;- well then, he can also live well in a palace.
1a14eba7-37f2-4bb8-b063-d47939c9150d.author: Marcus Aurelius

26888a72-570b-4cf1-aa39-a60c30801a66.text: Where is harm to be found? In your capacity to see it. Stop doing that and everything will be fine.
26888a72-570b-4cf1-aa39-a60c30801a66.author: Marcus Aurelius

78c3a8a7-4714-4d0b-a807-9e58fd4b10fc.text: Wherein Antoninus recordeth, What and of whom, whether Parents, Friends, or Masters; by their good examples, or good advice and counsel, he had learned.
78c3a8a7-4714-4d0b-a807-9e58fd4b10fc.author: Marcus Aurelius

cc7d8e2c-9ca7-4513-9f8b-92607a831a19.text: Wherever you go, there you are—the same person, with the same patterns of thought.
cc7d8e2c-9ca7-4513-9f8b-92607a831a19.author: Marcus Aurelius

ddba2bdc-a3d3-42b1-8e48-507e1013a39a.text: Whoever does wrong, wrongs himself; whoever does injustice, does it to himself, making himself evil.
ddba2bdc-a3d3-42b1-8e48-507e1013a39a.author: Marcus Aurelius

377218a8-2e0e-4dee-8ccc-3b3eef6e01b4.text: Why all this guesswork? You can see what needs to be done. If you can see the road, follow it.
377218a8-2e0e-4dee-8ccc-3b3eef6e01b4.author: Marcus Aurelius

b0b188e9-6121-44b6-86f5-4e171bde6266.text: Why doth a little thing said or done against thee make thee sorry? It is no new thing; it is not the first, nor shall it be the last, if thou live long. At best suffer patiently, if thou canst not suffer joyously.
b0b188e9-6121-44b6-86f5-4e171bde6266.author: Marcus Aurelius

9e3a3d79-14a9-4b47-848b-3d8290c640aa.text: Will any man despise me? Let him see to it. But I will see to it that I may not be found doing or saying anything that deserves to be despised.
9e3a3d79-14a9-4b47-848b-3d8290c640aa.author: Marcus Aurelius

cd7915bb-ab46-4733-8560-03d19adc350a.text: Wilt thou, then, my soul, never be good and simple and one and naked, more manifest than the body which surrounds thee?
cd7915bb-ab46-4733-8560-03d19adc350a.author: Marcus Aurelius

72c91869-7ab0-471b-bbd0-68105103a7ff.text: With how little he was satisfied, such as lodging, bed, dress, food, servants.
72c91869-7ab0-471b-bbd0-68105103a7ff.author: Marcus Aurelius

53adf159-7ef3-4e00-8848-79b233454db3.text: With respect to pain, then, and pleasure, or death and life, or honour and dishonour, which the universal nature employs equally, whoever is not equally affected is manifestly acting impiously.
53adf159-7ef3-4e00-8848-79b233454db3.author: Marcus Aurelius

bf9634b4-6077-4a92-98c7-16d107f218d2.text: Within ten days you will seem a god to those to whom you are now a beast and an ape, if you will return to your principles and the worship of reason.
bf9634b4-6077-4a92-98c7-16d107f218d2.author: Marcus Aurelius

c528f181-1d69-49c7-ac07-cdef641b459b.text: Work done with anxiety about results is far inferior to work done without such anxiety, in the calm of self surrender.
c528f181-1d69-49c7-ac07-cdef641b459b.author: Marcus Aurelius

9cb0d9aa-3fe1-493d-8f0f-174a7ba1352d.text: Yes, keep on degrading yourself, soul. But soon your chance at dignity will be gone. Everyone gets one life. Yours is almost used up, and instead of treating yourself with respect, you have entrusted your own happiness to the souls of others.
9cb0d9aa-3fe1-493d-8f0f-174a7ba1352d.author: Marcus Aurelius

269592d3-8f30-4837-afa7-ce50def658c2.text: Yes, you can—if you do everything as if it were the last thing you were doing in your life, and stop being aimless, stop letting your emotions override what your mind tells you, stop being hypocritical, self-centered, irritable.
269592d3-8f30-4837-afa7-ce50def658c2.author: Marcus Aurelius

f15a933a-5c96-495d-ac27-6ba5d7159c33.text: You always own the option of having no opinion. There is never any need to get worked up or to trouble your soul about things you can't control. These things are not asking to be judged by you. Leave them alone.
f15a933a-5c96-495d-ac27-6ba5d7159c33.author: Marcus Aurelius

d29501b1-673f-45d5-82d8-b87faa1e222b.text: You are a little soul carrying about a corpse, as Epictetus used to say.
d29501b1-673f-45d5-82d8-b87faa1e222b.author: Marcus Aurelius

e850504c-a794-4ee4-bf2c-e366a52bba47.text: You are a spirit, bearing the weight of a dead body, as Epictetus used to say.
e850504c-a794-4ee4-bf2c-e366a52bba47.author: Marcus Aurelius

e7bdcfb1-564b-4fb2-a0ba-341c0d147183.text: You are but an impression, and not at all what you seem to be'.
e7bdcfb1-564b-4fb2-a0ba-341c0d147183.author: Marcus Aurelius

5dbb99e6-e54f-4556-a799-01d7c95173c9.text: You can live here as you expect to live there.
5dbb99e6-e54f-4556-a799-01d7c95173c9.author: Marcus Aurelius

8c120f0b-e004-4709-b757-6ee076c272e1.text: You could leave life right now. Let that determine what you do and say and think.
8c120f0b-e004-4709-b757-6ee076c272e1.author: Marcus Aurelius

b6927523-3730-4bec-a838-6b3ed92c8304.text: You have a mind? —Yes. Well, why not use it? Isn’t that all you want—for it to do its job?
b6927523-3730-4bec-a838-6b3ed92c8304.author: Marcus Aurelius

da95c8f2-8f91-47ec-b644-80fe9127e54d.text: You have grown beyond supposing such actions to be either good or bad, and therefore it will be so much the easier to be tolerant of another's blindness.
da95c8f2-8f91-47ec-b644-80fe9127e54d.author: Marcus Aurelius

e6995ef7-46f5-4748-b393-08cb5f17e216.text: You have no assurance that they are doing wrong at all, for the motives of man's actions are not always what they seem. There is generally much to learn before any judgement can be pronounced with certainty on another's doings.
e6995ef7-46f5-4748-b393-08cb5f17e216.author: Marcus Aurelius

a11882b3-5635-4682-b029-5b2571b4ce74.text: You have power over your mind - not outside events. Realize this, and you will find strength.
a11882b3-5635-4682-b029-5b2571b4ce74.author: Marcus Aurelius

8e1a36d7-9432-44b9-a535-8a71836903b4.text: You have power over your mind - not outside events. Realize this, and you will find strength. When you arise in the morning, think of what a precious privilege it is to be alive - to breathe, to think, to enjoy, to love.
8e1a36d7-9432-44b9-a535-8a71836903b4.author: Marcus Aurelius

2c52905a-b13d-4f85-8c9c-2908a10d5ba8.text: You should always look on human life as short and cheap. Yesterday sperm: tomorrow a mummy or ashes.
2c52905a-b13d-4f85-8c9c-2908a10d5ba8.author: Marcus Aurelius

9468ec5f-9c20-4b5f-88a0-8a0a3976bc6f.text: Your character is simply the sum of your thoughts over time.
9468ec5f-9c20-4b5f-88a0-8a0a3976bc6f.author: Marcus Aurelius

2f55e074-1c6f-4062-b797-f0dcbb167c77.text: Your days are numbered. Use them to throw open the windows of your soul to the sun. If you do not, the sun will soon set, and you with it.
2f55e074-1c6f-4062-b797-f0dcbb167c77.author: Marcus Aurelius

21fbae8c-d28a-4206-a221-08ac7b7d5b05.text: Your life is what your thoughts make it.
21fbae8c-d28a-4206-a221-08ac7b7d5b05.author: Marcus Aurelius

04ea9453-d7bf-4ebf-a807-6fd268364a2c.text: Your mind will be like its habitual thoughts; for the soul becomes dyed with the color of its thoughts.
04ea9453-d7bf-4ebf-a807-6fd268364a2c.author: Marcus Aurelius

dab1bf0d-dbe6-4820-80c7-7ac37e3a5e89.text: Your mind will be like its habitual thoughts; for the soul becomes dyed with the colour of its thoughts.
dab1bf0d-dbe6-4820-80c7-7ac37e3a5e89.author: Marcus Aurelius

2bad9ed8-aebe-418a-86aa-a17ae68383aa.text: Your mind will take on the character of your most frequent thoughts: souls are dyed by thoughts.
2bad9ed8-aebe-418a-86aa-a17ae68383aa.author: Marcus Aurelius

52d76075-31f8-42eb-afc4-b6ee79f5bf67.text: Your principles have life in them. For how can they perish, unless the ideas that correspond to them are extinguished? And it is up to you to be constantly fanning them into new flame.
52d76075-31f8-42eb-afc4-b6ee79f5bf67.author: Marcus Aurelius

1918bcce-9f47-4dab-bbe2-a217f43ec3e0.text: You’ve given aid and they’ve received it. And yet, like an idiot, you keep holding out for more: to be credited with a Good Deed, to be repaid in kind. Why?
1918bcce-9f47-4dab-bbe2-a217f43ec3e0.author: Marcus Aurelius

b4e6b93c-9b85-48f5-b66d-4e822cdf7eb2.text: ‎Begin the morning by saying to thyself, I shall meet with the busy-body, the ungrateful, arrogant, deceitful, envious, unsocial.
b4e6b93c-9b85-48f5-b66d-4e822cdf7eb2.author: Marcus Aurelius

71b8c0a1-63d7-418c-80b8-269df1dcfc70.text: Lead me, O Zeus, and thou O Destiny, the way that I am bid by you to go: To follow I am ready. If I choose not, I make myself a wretch, and still must follow.
71b8c0a1-63d7-418c-80b8-269df1dcfc70.author: Cleanthes

70d39498-63bc-4cda-8059-a355e06683df.text: "But to be hanged — is that not unendurable?" Even so, when a man feels that it is reasonable, he goes off and hangs himself.
70d39498-63bc-4cda-8059-a355e06683df.author: Epictetus

97191af5-7b52-4e19-b3a0-521a7709cf97.text: "I'll show you that I’m master." —How will you do that? Zeus has set me free. Do you really suppose that he would allow his own son to be turned into a slave? You’re master of my carcass, take that.
97191af5-7b52-4e19-b3a0-521a7709cf97.author: Epictetus

09e0bf6b-b62a-49cc-8fa7-04a77166d241.text: "Who is a friend?" his answer was, "A second self (alter ego)."
09e0bf6b-b62a-49cc-8fa7-04a77166d241.author: Epictetus

5f44f61c-2ae8-4d3e-91aa-1df62cf93e0d.text: A city is not adorned by external things, but by the virtue of those who dwell in it.
5f44f61c-2ae8-4d3e-91aa-1df62cf93e0d.author: Epictetus

1971f264-9a91-4ab4-9d3d-afe2449d6b37.text: A ship should not ride on a single anchor, nor life on a single hope.
1971f264-9a91-4ab4-9d3d-afe2449d6b37.author: Epictetus

3bc51c8f-0f3d-42d6-bd81-843aa8d6ac8b.text: Adopt new habits yourself: consolidate your principles by putting them into practice.
3bc51c8f-0f3d-42d6-bd81-843aa8d6ac8b.author: Epictetus

e81913ca-edd0-4ef5-b9ca-a73578216614.text: All philosophy lies in two words, sustain and abstain.
e81913ca-edd0-4ef5-b9ca-a73578216614.author: Epictetus
